alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 2:17PM CST until January 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Fort Bend, Harris and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Though rain rates are diminishing, additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will maintain any ongoing minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Katy, Tomball, Jersey Village, Bunker Hill Village, Pinehurst, Addicks Park Ten, Spring Branch North, Spring Branch West, Eldridge / West Oaks, The Woodlands, Spring, Fulshear, Stagecoach, Cypress, Willowbrook, Carverdale, Hooks Airport, Westbranch, Fairbanks / Northwest Crossing and Greater Inwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
